intro: Tricostularia drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's trichostema, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Tricostularia drummondii is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
